alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; Plaquemines; St. Bernard; St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 3:20PM CDT until September 04 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans, Plaquemines, St. Bernard and St. Charles. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Harvey, East New Orleans, Gretna, Jean Lafitte, Arabi, Terrytown, Meraux, Violet, Woodmere, Estelle and Lafitte. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Jefferson; Orleans; Plaquemines; St. Bernard; St. Charles
